questiontext.text:
Categorise the following partial differential equations:

$$ \small \frac{\partial^2 u}{\partial x^2} = x \frac{\partial^2 u}{\partial t^2} $$

{1:MULTICHOICE:~Elliptic#$$ \small y = \partialy $$~None of the above#Incorrect~Partially hyperbolic and partially elliptic#Incorrect~=Hyperbolic#Correct}

$$ \small y\frac{\partial^2 u}{\partial x^2} + x \frac{\partial^2 u}{\partial x \partial y} = 0 $$

{1:MULTICHOICE:~=Hyperbolic#Correct~Partially hyperbolic, partially parabolic and partially elliptic#Incorrect~None of the above#Incorrect~Partially hyperbolic and partially elliptic#Incorrect}

$$ \small (1+ y) \frac{\partial^2 u}{\partial x^2} + (1 + 2y) \frac{\partial^2 u}{\partial x \partial y} + 4y \frac{\partial^2 u}{\partial y^2} = 0 $$

{1:MULTICHOICE:~=Hyperbolic#Correct~Elliptic#Incorrect~None of the above#Incorrect~Parabolic#Incorrect}

$$ \small (1+ y) \frac{\partial^2 u}{\partial x^2} + (1 + 2y) \frac{\partial^2 u}{\partial x \partial y} + 4y \frac{\partial^2 u}{\partial y^2} = 0 $$

{1:MULTICHOICE:~=Linear homogeneous#Correct~Linear inhomogeneous#Incorrect~Nonlinear homogeneous#Incorrect~Nonlinear inhomogeneous#Incorrect}
